title: Haworth-Hebden Bridge Walk Route

images.title: SpaceMonkey at the English language Wikipedia / CC BY-SA (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/)
images.caption: Main Street, Haworth, West Yorkshire

images.title: Phil Champion / Penistone Hill Country Park and Lower Laithe Reservoir
images.caption: Penistone Hill Country Park and Lower Laithe Reservoir. The village beyond the reservoir is Stanbury, which lies in the adjacent square

images.title: Phil Champion / Hardcastle Crags
images.caption: Hardcastle Crags. The name 'Hardcastle Crags' is used to refer to the whole of the National Trusts estate on both sides of Hebden Dale . Most visitors don't stray past Gibson Mill. The Crags themselves are to the north of that point between the main track and the Hebden Water

images.title: Raymond Knapman / Lumb Hole Waterfall
images.caption: Lumb Hole Waterfall. Picturesque waterfall on Crimsworth Dean Beck near Stone Booth Farm, north of Pecket Well.

images.title: michael ely / Bridge over Hebden Water, Hebden Bridge
images.caption: Bridge over Hebden Water, Hebden Bridge

description: This walking path takes you through some beautiful Yorkshire countryside from Haworth to Hebden Bridge . It runs for about 8 miles, linking two of the more popular settlements of the area. The walk starts in Penistone Hill Country Park near Haworth and heads south passing Lower Laithe and Leeshaw Reservoirs. You will also pass the splendid Lumb Hole waterfalls and the beautiful wooded valley at Hardcastle Crags before following Crimsworth Dean Beck and Hebden Water to Hebden Bridge.
